item.title: Minecraft Is Finally Getting The Theme Park Treatment, But Not How You'd Expect
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/minecraft-is-finally-getting-the-theme-park-treatment-but-not-how-youd-expect/1100-6527853/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Merlin Entertainments has announced a new partnership with Mojang Studios to "bring Minecraft adventures to life" with rides and attractions across the world.

Merlin is spending more than $110 million on this deal, which the company says will lead to "immersive and interactive entertainment attractions in fixed locations around the globe."

The press release was light on official details, but it did mention how the deal also covers the development of real-world "touchpoints" that people can access to unlock in-game content.

The initial $110 million investment covers two attractions, one each for the US and the UK; they are set to open in either 2026 or 2027 at unspecified locations. "This will include the development of first-of-its-kind concepts for Minecraft-themed guest accommodation, retail, and food & beverage, alongside exciting experiences--including a Minecraft-themed ride--at Merlin locations in these two countries. Longer-term, Merlin will expand these experiences to other destinations globally," the company said.

Merlin runs the Legoland theme parks, as well as theme parks in the UK, Italy, and Germany, including Alton Towers Resort and Gardaland Resort. Merlin also operates what it calls "Gateway" attractions, which include Madame Tussauds, Sea Life, and attractions themed around brands like Peppa Pig and Shrek.

Merlin's Magic Making team is working with Mojang to try to "ensure authenticity" for the Minecraft rides and attractions that it creates. Minecraft is the first video game franchise that Merlin has partnered with.

Minecraft is among the best-selling video games of all time, and the franchise remains popular. A Minecraft movie is on the way, starring Jason Momoa and Jack Black, and the newest trailer comes out today, November 19.

In other theme park news, Nintendo and Universal just announced more details on the Donkey Kong Country area of Universal Studios Japan, which is set to open in 2025. In the US, it's the final countdown for one of Disney World's best rides, Magic Kingdom's Big Thunder Mountain Railroad, which closes on January 6, 2025 and won't open for an entire year.

item.title: Sony Looking To Acquire Elden Ring Dev From Software - Report
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sony-looking-to-acquire-elden-ring-dev-from-software-report/1100-6527852/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sony, parent company of PlayStation, is reportedly in discussions to purchase Kadokawa, parent company of Elden Ring maker From Software. The two companies have been talking, and it's apparently possible an acquisition could be announced in the weeks ahead.

According to Reuters, a possible acquisition would see Sony own the rights to Elden Ring and future games from From Software, also known for Demon Souls (already owned by Sony) and Dark Souls (controlled by publisher Bandai Namco). Acquire, behind Tenchu, and Spike Chunsoft, behind Danganronpa, also sit under Kadokawa's umbrella and presumably would be part of any merger. Sony already owns a 2% stake in the company.

Kadokawa's portfolio doesn't just include gaming, though. The company also has a hand in anime and manga, behind franchises like Re:Zero and Delicious in Dungeon. In 2021, Sony acquired anime streaming service Crunchyroll for over $1 billion.

Elden Ring is one of the biggest video games in the world, selling over 25 million copies before the launch of the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. The action-RPG was also GameSpot's Game of the Year for 2022.

In June, Shadow of the Erdtree launched to critical and commercial praise. The Elden Ring expansion is nominated for multiple The Game Awards 2024 categories, including Game of the Year.

Meanwhile, last month, Sony shuttered Concord developer Firewalk Studios after the shooter's failed launch. Earlier this year, Sony also cut roughly 900 gaming jobs and canceled PlayStation projects.

item.title: Rebirth Island Removed From Warzone Just Hours After It Returned
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/rebirth-island-removed-from-warzone-just-hours-after-it-returned/1100-6527843/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Rebirth Island has been removed from the Call of Duty: Warzone playlist due to "map-specific issues," just hours after the popular map returned. Players are waiting on further updates from Treyarch to find out when the map is likely to be returned to rotation.

It's a busy time for Warzone, after its big integration with Black Ops 6 and Season 1 launch last week. The update brought Black Ops 6 operators, weapons, and even game features to Warzone, as well as the new Area 99 Resurgence map, however the integration hasn't been without its hiccups. Players have experienced issues, especially with game audio, as well as with performance on PC.

Players might have been looking forward to playing the popular Rebirth Island map when it was re-added to Warzone with this week's playlist refresh, but the map was pulled from rotation just over three hours after it was added.

📢 #Warzone
We've removed Rebirth Island from the playlist while we investigate map-specific issues. Other maps and modes remain unaffected.
We will post updates here when we have more to share.

— Call of Duty Updates (@CODUpdates) November 18, 2024

Treyarch has said that the issue in question is map-specific, and that "other maps and modes remain unaffected." The post said further updates would be posted to the same account, but it's currently unclear how quickly the issue is likely to be addressed.

The Warzone developer has already been hard at work patching issues associated with the Season 1 launch, with the first patch coming the day after the season started. Other posts on the CoD Updates X (formerly Twitter) account show that the team has already resolved a number of issues, so hopefully players will be able to jump back into Rebirth Island soon--but for now, they'll have to stick to exploring Area 99.

item.title: Fields Of Mistria Gets First Major Update With Expanded Romance, Mimics, and Ridable Unicorns
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fields-of-mistria-gets-first-major-update-with-expanded-romance-mimics-and-ridable-unicorns/1100-6527840/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The shojo-anime-tinged farming game Fields of Mistria is getting its first major content patch. It includes a new seasonal festival, mounts--including unicorns, llamas, cows, and sheep--and expanded romance routes.

The updates includes the "Shooting Star Festival," which takes place in-game on Summer 28. Romancable NPCs can be invited to stargaze if you have four or more hearts with them. As for other town-related additions, the renown level cap has been raised to 70, and you'll receive new rewards and new "Crown Requests" after level 50. You can buy more items at Merri's, Vera's, and Louis's market stalls. You can claim new sets and rewards at the museum for the Insect, Archaeology, and Fish wings.

After repairing Hayden's barn, you can ride mounts (and you'll unlock a set of relevant skills to boot). Skill caps across the board have been raised from 30 to 45. You can also encounter two new monsters in the mines--the Essence Bat and the Mimic--and pick up new rare cosmetic items from them.

In romance and relationships, you can now raise your affection with romancable NPCs to six hearts. When you do so, you'll unlock new events with them. Additional NPC dialogue has also been added.

According to the game's roadmap, future updates will include even more festivals, skill and level cap raises, and marriage. You can check out the full patch notes for this update below and on the Fields of Mistria website.

Full Fields of Mistria v0.12.0 Patch Notes

Patch notes will feature a 🌼 emoji whenever the change is based on community feedback and bug reporting!

Highlights

  • Romanceable’s Six Heart Events have been added.
  • Rideable mounts and mount-specific Skill Perks have been added. Note: The “Upgrade Hayden’s Barn” quest must be finished in order to unlock the Mount Questline.
  • The Shooting Star Festival on Summer 28 has been added.Note: To experience the date aspect of the festival, the “Beautification Project” quest must be completed. To invite a Romanceable NPC, their Heart Level must be 4+.
  • Two new home upgrades are now available.
  • 21 new Tier 4 Skill Perks have been added (see [New Features] for more details).
  • A new special type of Request Board request called "Crown Requests" has been added (see [New Features] for more details).
  • New museum sets and rewards have been added for the Insect, Archaeology, and Fish wings.
  • Saturday Market vendors (Louis, Vera, and Merri) have new items in stock.
  • Two new monsters can be found in the Mines - the Essence Bat and the Mimic.

New Features

Gameplay

  • The Renown level cap has been raised from 50 to 70, with new rewards to obtain.
  • All skills can now be leveled up to level 45, unlocking 21 new Tier 4 perks: 2 Archaeology, 3 Farming, 3 Fishing, 3 Ranching, 3 Cooking, 3 Woodcrafting, 1 Blacksmithing, 2 Combat, 1 Mining. Some notable highlights:- [Mining] Lost to History: Ritual Chamber rooms can now spawn in the Mines. These rooms contain new collectible items.- [Ranching] The Bell Tolls: Unlocks the Big Bell item, which calls in/out all animals on the farm when used.- [Farming] Sickle Sword: Unlock to use your sword to harvest crops quickly.- [Crafting] Deliberate Debris: Farm debris will spawn 50% less often.
  • 🌼 One new Tier 3 Ranching Skill Perk has been added:- Wind Down: The Mill Time for all mill recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.
  • Crown Requests: After achieving Town Rank Sapphire (Lv 50), special Request Board quests called “Crown Requests” will begin appearing once a week. These requests reward more Renown than a regular request.
  • 25 new requests have been added to the Request Board.
  • Monsters in the Mines each have a rare chance of dropping a new cosmetic item.
  • Large Barns and Large Coops will now become available to purchase at Ranching Lvl 40.

QOL

  • 🌼 Perks can now be enabled and disabled from the Dragon Shrine menu.
  • New default hairstyles have been added.
  • A big stone has been added to the river in the Narrows for easier traversal on mounts.

Art

  • Hayden’s Farm now has animals roaming about.
  • New animal cosmetics have been added to Hayden’s Shop and the Chicken Statue.
  • The Cottage Garden Decor furniture set has been added to the game. These items/recipes can be obtained as Renown Rewards between Lv 51-60.
  • The Noble Cosmetic set has been added to the game. These items can be obtained as Renown Rewards between Lv 61-70.

NPCs

  • You can now level up all NPCs’ heart levels to 6 hearts.
  • New dialogue has been added for all NPCs.

Sound

  • An additional Rainy Day music track has been added

Updates

Gameplay

  • Treasure Rooms in the Mines now spawn as intended.
  • 🌼 Chestnuts now visually leave a shell behind when foraged, preventing the foraging spots from being mistaken for dig sites.
  • 🌼 Fish now ignore collisions when they are attracted to a lure and will no longer be stopped by running into rocks or corner pieces of land.
  • 🌼 Fishing experience gain has been increased.
  • 🌼 Pond Skater’s description has been updated to reflect that it can be found in all seasons.
  • 🌼The rate of forage and bugs appearing in the Mines has been increased.
  • Controller Button Mapping: Clicking the Left Stick has been remapped to summon the mount. (prev. used to navigate to the previous toolbar tab).

QOL

  • The amount of Renown earned per quest is now displayed in the popup upon quest completion and when accepting a quest.
  • It is now easier to navigate the Skill Perks menu down to view locked perks.
  • Furniture previews are no longer visible when swimming while holding furniture.
  • There is now a pop up confirmation when the player upgrades their house.
  • The game font now supports additional Latin characters.
  • The Mushroom Cut is now in the Short Hair category instead of Medium Hair.

Art

  • Small edits have been made to Juniper’s room, including making Dozy’s bed visible.
  • Held items now appear above the player’s head gear accessories when the player is facing in any direction.
  • 🌼 It is now possible to place objects on top of Coral Tables from the Tide furniture set.

NPCs

  • Terithia now sells additional recipes and Seaweed at her shop.
  • 🌼 The General Store now sells Soy Sauce.

Sound

  • Lowered the wind ambiance volume on the Summit.

Bug Fixes

Gameplay

  • 🌼 Chickpeas now regrow as per their seed description.
  • 🌼 Animals now produce products regularly without interruption (it was previously possible to interrupt the product schedule by manually saving and loading the game).
  • 🌼 Crystal Caterpillar can now be found on both blizzard and snowy days.
  • Animals no longer walk through fences, into barns, or onto water when exiting the coop.
  • 🌼 Players can no longer obtain multiple Legendary Fish (extra Legendary Fish in a player’s possession will be removed).
  • 🌼 Placing items in the Seal Tablet boxes without hitting the Offer button now pops items onto the ground instead of disappearing.
  • 🌼 Players can no longer duplicate items that are <Hold to Use> by dragging them to a new toolbar slot while using them.
  • Saving and then loading into the save file will no longer refresh daily requests.
  • 🌼 Rapidly skipping the bathhouse cutscene no longer traps the player in the bathhouse.
  • 🌼 The “A Day Well Spent” stamina bonus can no longer be undone by any form of stamina restoration.
  • 🌼 Using the Summon Rain spell at 1:50am no longer causes the following day to have Clear weather.
  • 🌼 Players can no longer get stuck inside collisions while swimming (e.g. after diving in a dive spot that is close to a rock).
  • 🌼 Players can no longer get stuck between the rocks of the southwestern beach island.
  • 🌼 When switching to the smallest resolution, the screen no longer goes black.
  • 🌼 Animals can no longer walk on cliffs when dismounting toys.
  • Collapsing on the farm while placing furniture or saplings no longer causes the previews to display during the End of Day cutscene.
  • 🌼 Learning the recipe for the Mushroom Stool, Wall/Floor Braziers, Mossy Rugs, and Crystal Lamps of the Cavern Furniture Set will now teach you the recipes for all color variants. (Note: if a player has already learned a recipe for one variant in their game, they’ll need to find the recipe scroll once more to learn all the remaining variants).
  • Fixed a bug with partially deleted preset outfits.
  • "Living Off the Land" perk rate has been lowered to work as intended.
  • New content added that should be available by default (ex. new default player hairstyles) will now be available when loading into older saves.
  • Using a controller to play and then switching back to mouse no longer renders the scrollbar unscrollable.

QOL

  • 🌼 Controls can no longer be rebound in a such a way that it causes the player to lose the ability to Reset Controls, hit Enter to Confirm in naming menus, or permanently lose the ability to pick up and place items in storage.
  • Throwing items now depth sorts correctly.

Art & Visuals

  • 🌼 Holding a small animal while entering cutscenes or crafting sequences no longer causes the animal to reappear in the player's hands after every subsequent cutscene.
  • 🌼 The Lovely Cottage Table can now be rotated (both variants).
  • 🌼 It is now possible to place objects on top of the Lovely Cottage Table (Oak variant.)
  • Furniture now depth sorts correctly when placed on top of other furniture.
  • Going to sleep while picking up an item no longer offsets the player's arms.
  • Animal icons in the UI now display correctly (The Sheep and Alpaca Fall Variant icons).
  • 🌼 The Weather Crystal Ball now displays the correct icon for snowy and blizzard days.
  • The Large Animal Ball Court Toy no longer renders underneath rugs.
  • Snowy footprints no longer appear when walking in the bathhouse or the Mines Entry room.
  • The Wishing Well and Chicken Statue now display the correct Winter sprite.
  • The Hawthorn sapling now appears in the appropriate seasonal color.
  • The log pile by the Carpenter’s Shop’s shadow now displays correctly.

UI

  • Legendary Fish now have the museum donation icon in their New Item popup.
  • Distinct icons for manual saves and autosaves in the Load Game menu have been restored.
  • 🌼 The Giant Koi fish now displays the correct icon.
  • 🌼 The color of the Gold Stud Earrings now displays correctly in the menu.
  • 🌼 The glyph on controller/SteamDeck for Plant Grass Starter is now correct
  • Improved tool-charged tile indicator fade.
  • Item names no longer spill over in the Quest UI turn in popup.
  • Seal Offering UI text no longer spills over.
  • The Fishing Tutorial popup no longer interferes with the Blacksmithing menu if a player acquires their first rod by blacksmithing.
  • The “learned recipe” popup no longer appears when a recipe scroll bundle item is acquired.
  • 🌼 When purchasing animals from Hayden’s Shop the proper amount of tesserae now visual subtracts.
  • Rapidly clicking in and out of the Skill Perks menu no longer distorts the menu.
  • The UI elements behind the animal adoption popup no longer go blank.

NPCs & Quests

  • Market vendors inventory rotation is now working as intended.
  • 🌼 The player now receives the correct letter from Adeline after her Four Heart event.
  • 🌼 Initiating certain cutscenes (ex. Ryis’ 2 Heart event) at the Inn after 8pm no longer causes the player to get stuck.
  • Balor’s Two Heart quest now rewards 200t as intended.
  • 🌼 Merri can no longer sell two Bakery Dessert Case recipes at once.
  • Balor can no longer sell two Lemons at once.
  • Vendors no longer say regular daytime dialogue when packing up.
  • Updated speaker info to correct NPC for specific dialogues.

Sound

  • All doors now make the correct closing sound.

❌ Crash Fixes

  • 🌼 Initiating a conversation with an NPC while transitioning into a cutscene no longer causes a crash.
  • 🌼 Placing down two adjacent fences on top of a hay bale no longer crashes the game.
  • 🌼 Placing furniture in specific spots that interferes with The Unusual Tree cutscene on Spring 2 no longer crashes the game. Any furniture interfering with the cutscene will now be returned to item form and can be picked up after the cutscene ends.
Grace Benfell on Google+
